abstract.p: New service from Google, Internet search engine, will allow Web-enabled cell phones to view any of estimated 1.6 billion pages on Web (S)

block.p: Web-enabled cell phones can now be used to view any of the estimated 1.6 billion pages on the Web with a new service from the Google search engine. The Google service, which was introduced last week, translates standard Web pages into wireless markup language, the programming language used by most cell phone browsers. Mobile searchers who go to the Google site can enter the address of any Web page and it will be translated and displayed. Some Nextel Communications phones began displaying the Google search option on Aug. 1.
